instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water damage
threads.message:
I have a water damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A logicboard. it had damage on the <SIGNAL>U3100_X</SIGNAL> area. I replaced <RESISTOR>R3070</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R3058</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R3057</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R3072</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R3033</RESISTOR>, and <SIGNAL>C3101_X</SIGNAL>
when I connect a charger I get 20V and it goes up to 0.79A then the Apple logo comes on but it'll be stuck on the logo and goes down to 0.40A, 0.30A, and A jumps up and down. Also, I noticed the <SIGNAL>D3100_X</SIGNAL> is damaged as well but I can't find <SIGNAL>D3100_X</SIGNAL>(NSR20F40NX_G) online to replace it. Would it be alright if I take it off and test the board or any advice on where I should look for?

[ATTACH type="full"]60395[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water damage
threads.message:
Board works without <DIODE>D3100</DIODE>.
However, no more protection agains charger spikes.

Machine remains with Apple logo, or turns off/restart?
As always for T2 machines, try DFU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water damage
threads.message: It stays on the Apple logo then fans kicks in at high speed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water damage
threads.message:
can't put it on DFU mode. when I connect a USB C. it won't take more than 5V & 0A. Any advice?

when the charger is connected
[ATTACH type="full" width="430px"]60406[/ATTACH]

when the charger and a USB C are connected

[ATTACH type="full" width="390px"]60407[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Water damage
threads.message:
Did you follow all the steps from DFU tutrial linked on the forum?
You can try to force DFU; using RE032 pads.
